title: Roland Giroux
text:
Roland Giroux, (15 January 1913 – 4 November 1991) was from 1969 to 1977 the Chairman of the Quebec Hydro-Electric Commission (today known generally as <a href="Hydro-Qu%C3%A9bec">Hydro-Québec</a>).
He is a member of the <a href="Order%20of%20Canada">Order of Canada</a>, first becoming an Officer in June 1972 then in July 1977 was promoted as a Companion, the highest rank within the order.
Giroux died of a heart attack in Quebec at age 78 leaving his wife Yvette Blain and three children.
